multi-threading 0: advanced features and performance options are not available
multi-threading 1: advanced features and performance options are available
kill timer: automatically closes the tool if the game client is not running
specify how long it may run without the game
browser features: enables additional features when accessing 3rd-party websites via the tool

examples:
-> chrome calculator: auto-paste stats
-> poe.db cluster jewels: auto-highlight type
-> poelab.com: import layout
capslock toggling: only uncheck this box if something outside of this tool is bound to capslock
whenever ahk sends inputs, it toggles capslock back and forth, which triggers whatever is bound to it (e.g. voice chat mute)
toggling this option will restart the tool
lang language: the tool will restart upon selection
lang unknown: the client's language couldn't be detected from reading its config-file
font-size: – and + can be held down, the middle button resets the size
animations: disable animations/transitions used in some menus and interfaces
generic color: click to open the color-palette, right click to reset
generic color double: text color: click to open the color-palette, right click to reset
generic color double1: background color: click to open the color-palette, right click to reset
input method 2: optional mode, (very) limited compatibility: a few features have modified behavior to remain functional in controller mode
controller support is low-priority and based on individual requests(/highlight)
active character: optional: enter the name of your current character
this enables level tracking and e-exp calculations
active character status: yellow: char not found / waiting for level-up
active character whois: click this button to use the "/whois" in-game command to force-refresh character info
make sure the in-game chat box is closed but available(/highlight)
ascendancy: the game only logs ascendancies when a character levels up
this label will be out of sync if you have recently (re)specced but not leveled up yet: in that case, click the refresh button on the left
active build: optional: enter a description for the current build
used in the map-tracker feature to log which build was played
logfile: the size and load-time of the game's client.txt log-file: excessively large log-files may negatively impact the game's and tool's performance
if you have issues with the game or log-related features, click the folder button on the right to open the game's log folder
logfolder: open the game's log folder to manually delete the log file: if you use tools that require the log-file, make a backup of the file first
the client.txt log-file can only be modified after closing the game(/highlight)
force resolution: you can force the client to run with a custom resolution not available by default
it will be applied on every tool start, or when starting the client while the tool is running
vertical resolutions (second value) are limited to specific ones for compatibility reasons
reset resolution: long-click to reset the client's resolution and delete custom-resolution settings
this is mainly for situations when the tool is forcing an incorrect resolution after changing monitors
client filler: blacks out the empty screen area around the client window and makes it unclickable
this black area can be used to place overlays outside the client area, and it also prevents misclicks on background windows
window position: the client has to be docked to a specific spot to ensure that overlays are positioned correctly
pick a preferred position, and the client will be placed there automatically every time
black bars: the client's aspect ratio is limited to 24:10 and there will be black bars if it's wider
this option repositions the tool's overlays and screen-checks to compensate for that
window borders: removes borders around the client window
write permissions: use this to troubleshoot write-permission issues on your system if the tool can't create/edit files
when these issues are detected, an error message will appear and ask you to run this test
if the test results show errors, move the tool-folder to a different location or restart the tool as admin, then re-run the test
actdecoder enable: provides an interactive zone-layout overlay for campaign areas
hold down the <widget-key> while in a supported campaign area to activate the overlay
accuracy can vary from patch to patch, so use them as rough guides instead of mini-map replacement(/highlight)
actdecoder generic: disables sub-layout selections and only shows basic layouts
credits: layouts created by engineering eternity, compiled by u/_treb
actdecoder generic 2: disables sub-layout selections and only shows basic layouts
actdecoder hotkey: optional: specify a hotkey as an alternative to the widget-key (which will then no longer activate the act-decoder)
this is primarily for improving wasd compatibility, e.g. by binding it to a thumb button (xbutton 1/2) on the mouse
holding this key will only activate the act-decoder, tapping it will use its normal function(/highlight)
actdecoder layouts opacity: the opacity (1 to 10) of the zone-layouts overlay in locked mode
actdecoder layouts locked zoom: custom zoom setting for when the overlay is locked (0 = disabled)
this means you can have separate settings while (not) holding down the hotkey
anoints enable: provides a quick-access interface to find and filter which recipes are available with the materials you currently have
it is accessed via the context-menu: hover over materials and press the <omni-key>
anoints update: this is mainly for league-start so the feature can be used without having to wait for a whole new release
betrayal enable: provides an interactive cheat sheet overlay for the betrayal league mechanic
requires the <betrayal> image-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
while the syndicate board is on screen, hold down the <omni-key> to activate the overlay
refer to the wiki-page for more information
betrayal ruthless: show ruthless rewards and use separate highlighting instead
betrayal color: click a button to open the color-palette, right click to reset
betrayal rewards: long-click a name below to show that member's rewards
hover over a reward and press a number key to apply a color, or space to remove it
rewards can also be tiered when using the overlay on the syndicate board
betrayal update: this is mainly for league-start so the feature can be used without having to wait for a whole new release
cheatsheets enable: provides a toolkit to create and manage customizable cheat sheet overlays
cheatsheets modifier-key: cheat sheets are activated by pressing the modifier and <omni-key> simultaneously
if a sheet is configured as <hold>, only the <omni-key> has to be held down
cheatsheets color: click a button to open the color-palette, right click to reset
hover over a note and press a number key to apply color, or press space to remove it
cheatsheets types: images: import/capture images and display them in an overlay, switch between them, or rearrange the information on them
app: specify an app and launch or bring it to the front with a single press of a button instead of tabbing out/repeatedly
advanced: create custom tooltips that show information for specific in-game elements while hovering over them
cheatsheets calibrate: pressing the key combination will open the correct sheet for what is on screen in game
for the tool to know which sheet is the correct one, manual calibration is required
opens the clipping tool: use it to clip a unique element from the in-game ui
cheatsheets test: click while the specific in-game ui is on screen, the test should return positive
click while the specific ui is not on screen, the test should return negative
results have to be consistent and repeatable
cheatsheets edit: opens a menu to configure the cheat sheet
cheatsheets delete: long-click to delete the cheat sheet
cheatsheets info: long-click to view the sheet's properties
cloneframes toggle-info: clone-frames can be toggled on/off automatically to avoid blocking in-game content

global: settings will apply to every clone-frame
custom: each frame can have its own settings
below, you can choose how clone-frames behave when certain in-game interfaces are on screen
requires additional setup in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
cloneframes toggle-modes: ignore: clone-frames will ignore what is on screen and will never toggle
hide: clone-frames will hide when the interface is on screen
show: clone-frames will show only when the specific interface is on screen
cloneframes performance: try to balance the number of clone-frames and the target fps so that the measured performance stays green
cloneframes new: to create a new frame, enter a name and press enter
cloneframes edit: enters edit-mode, which activates the section below and allows you to adjust the frame's settings
cloneframes groups: optional: you can assign frames to groups 0 to 9
when editing a frame's opacity or target coordinate (yellow), the whole group will be edited accordingly
hold down <shift> while editing to ignore group settings and only edit the currently-selected frame(/highlight)
cloneframes corners: in edit-mode, source and target frames have colored corners that correspond to a mouse-button (boxes on the right)
click a button to move the corner to the cursor's current position, press <esc> or click <discard> to exit edit-mode
you can also adjust the values below for fine-tuning and more control
cloneframes scroll: for fine-tuning, scroll the mouse-wheel to adjust this value by 1
exchange enable: provides a ratio calculator, small ux improvements, trade logging, and balance tracking for the in-game currency exchange
requires the <currency exchange> and <inventory> checks to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
while the currency exchange is on screen, press the <omni-key> to activate the feature
hold down <alt> to temporarily hide the overlay
exchange delete logs: long-click to delete the entire trade log
exchange graphs: visualizes how your in-/outflow developed over the course of a specific day and the past week
hotkeys ingame-keybinds:
to avoid conflicts between custom in-game keybinds and the tool's hotkeys:
- tick anything that applies to you
- provide alternative keys when asked to
hotkeys formatting: for special keys, check the links above to find proper names and formatting
don't use modifier-keys, the 3 main mouse-buttons, or space(/highlight)
hotkeys modifiers: you can add one or more modifier-keys to this hotkey
hotkeys movekey: only required when using cursor-movement, not wasd(/highlight)
specifying the key allows the tool to adapt its behavior in certain situations
example: not activating on-hover overlays while moving the character
hotkeys omnikey-info:
context-sensitive hotkey that activates the majority of features
(default: capslock)
instead of specifying hotkeys for every feature, you calibrate screen-checks to help this hotkey interpret which feature has to be activated when pressed
hotkeys omnikey2: due to an in-game inconsistency, having the c-key rebound requires a secondary <omni-key> for items
whenever a feature requires you to press the <omni-key> over an item, you will have to use this secondary one
hotkeys omniblock: while the game-client or tool is focused, the keypress will only be registered by the tool and not the rest of the system
this means special keys (e.g. windows or accent keys, capslock, etc.) can be used without their usual side effects
hotkeys tab: long-pressing this hotkey (re)activates certain widgets and non-permanent overlays
if something is bound to <tab> in game and requires a long-press (e.g. skills, movement), you'll have to specify an alternative key in the edit field
hotkeys restart: if the tool stops responding, use this hotkey to restart it
hotkeys menu-widget alternative: if holding down <esc> doesn't open the menu-widget, you can use this alternative key instead
unlike <esc>, this key doesn't need to be held down
leave it blank if you don't want to have an alternative key
iteminfo enable: provides a customizable item tooltip which adds glance value to loot you pick up
iteminfo profiles: customized highlighting can be saved in individual profiles
if the tooltip is on screen when selecting a profile, the changes will be applied on the fly
iteminfo reset: long-click one of the buttons to reset specific highlighting in the currently-selected profile
iteminfo toggle: long-press the <omni-key> over items to activate the tooltip: if already active, normal <omni-key> presses over items will activate/refresh it again
click into the game or press <esc> to close it
iteminfo hold: long-press the <omni-key> over items to activate the tooltip
the tooltip will close automatically once you release the key
iteminfo modrolls: hide the min/max range on explicit mods

+89 to maximum life
vs.
+89(80-89) to maximum Life
iteminfo modbars tier: roll-ranges in mod-texts and on bars will represent the roll within the current tier, i.e. the divine orb range

example, t2 movement speed:
30% inc. movement speed
iteminfo modbars global: roll-ranges in mod-texts and on bars will represent the roll on a global scale, i.e. from worst to best possible roll

example, t2 movement speed:
30%(10-35) inc. movement speed
iteminfo modbars ilevel: roll-ranges in mod-texts and on bars will represent the roll on an ilvl scale, i.e. from worst to best possible roll within the given ilvl

example, t2 movement speed on ilvl 74 boots:
30%(10-30) inc. movement speed
iteminfo quality scaling: shows an additional line at the bottom with defense/damage values after applying quality and greater iron runes
this can be used to preview a crafted/looted item's theoretical max values
iteminfo shift-click: automatically refreshes/activates the tooltip when applying currency to items via shift-click
you have to hold down <shift> first, right click currency, and then click items(/highlight)
requires the <inventory> pixel-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
iteminfo league-start: adds a section where the item's stats are compared to your current gear
hover over gear slots in the inventory and long-click the refresh buttons to load the info from equipped items, or long-right-click to clear the slot
requires the <inventory> pixel-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
iteminfo affix-info icon: the last column will show an icon for the mod-group of an affix (if available)
iteminfo affix-info ilvl: the last column will show the ilvl requirement for each affix, which exposes high-tier but low-lvl mods
this option caters more to advanced users because it adds even more information
iteminfo affix-info max tier: the last column will show the maximum tier possible at the item's current ilvl
this can be used to check how close affixes are to the ilvl-restricted maximum tier
iteminfo affix-info off: don't show any information about affixes in the last column
iteminfo base-info: adds a section that shows how the item's stats compare to the best-in-class stats
it also shows the base-percentile roll and ilvl, highlighting good values
iteminfo base-info 2: adds a section that shows how the item's stats compare to the best-in-class stats
iteminfo marking global: colors used to highlight globally (un)desired mods
click a box to open the color-palette, right click to reset
iteminfo marking class: colors used to highlight class-specifically (un)desired mods
click a box to open the color-palette, right click to reset
iteminfo item-tier: click a box to open the color-palette, right click to reset
<fr> refers to fractured, <#> to untiered mods
iteminfo item-level: click a box to open the color-palette, right click to reset
iteminfo override: tiers/ilvl on undesired mods (except fractured) will be highlighted by the <undesired> color instead of the usual color
this will also hide the last column on undesired mods to improve visual clarity
iteminfo rules: single-click solution to mark larger mod groups as (un)desired
the name specifies which mods are affected, the color whether they'll be set to (un)desired
lang unavailable: this feature is currently not available on non-english clients
lang incompatible: this feature is not available on clients with an unsupported language
it will be available once a language-pack for the current language has been installed
leveltracker enable: provides an automated campaign guide-overlay and several qol features
adds a button to the menu-widget with which to toggle the guide overlay
leveltracker timer: adds a timer between guide text and navigation buttons that records your act times and stores them in csv-files

timer structure:
total time | act # | current act time

click <act #> to pause/resume the timer
(it will auto-pause when afk for 10+ seconds)
how to reset: in the first zone or town, long-right-click on <act #>
leveltracker timer-pause: automatically pauses the timer in hideouts, and resumes it when you leave
leveltracker fade-timer: automatically hides the overlay after a delay (except when in towns)
delay: x seconds after switching guide pages
whenever it switches pages, the overlay will be shown again and the delay will be restarted
it will also be shown while holding down the <widget-key>
leveltracker fade mouse: overlay will be shown while hovering the cursor over its previous area
has no effect while the move key is pressed (customizable in the hotkeys section)
leveltracker recommendation: includes level recommendations for some areas or boss fights
leveltracker geartracker:
notifies you when you meet gear or gem requirements after lvl-ups (mainly a twink feature):
the guide overlay will display <gear rdy>
requires your character-name in the <general> settings(/highlight)
accessed by right-clicking the act-tracker button in the menu-widget or clicking <gear rdy> in the guide overlay
leveltracker expbar: slightly moves the guide-overlay up so it doesn't cover the exp-bar
leveltracker skilltree-info: long-press the <omni-key> over a gem to show gem setups/links
you can switch between skill sets by scrolling the mouse wheel
while the skill-tree is on screen, press the <omni-key> to show overlays with skill-tree schematics
requires the <skilltree> image-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
leveltracker skilltree clear: long-click to delete the skill-tree files used to render schematics: they will be re-downloaded the next time they are needed
deleting them is only required if the schematics are outdated or otherwise incorrect
leveltracker pob gems: the gem-overlay will stay on screen after releasing the <omni-key>, until you press <esc>
this option also allows the overlay to be moved around by long-clicking a gem-name in the list(s)
clicking a gem-name in the list(s) will start an in-game search for that gem
leveltracker pob manual: the tree-overlay will use manual screen-caps instead of schematics rendered from pob's data

this changes how the overlay is accessed:
- hold down the <omni-key> while the tree is on screen
- scroll to switch between images(/highlight)
leveltracker pob: m-mouse in pob will open the screen-cap menu
use this menu to manage overlay images
leveltracker screen-cap menu: use this menu to manage overlay images
leveltracker folder: opens the folder with overlay images
if you want to edit the images yourself, you can move them to this folder manually
leveltracker tree hotkey: optional: if you close the in-game passive tree by pressing its hotkey again or the <close all ui> hotkey, you can specify it here
whenever you press that hotkey to close the in-game tree, the tree overlay will also close
leveltracker profile create: click to add a guide slot
leveltracker profile select: click to activate this guide slot
long-right-click to delete this guide slot
leveltracker import: imports pobb.in-links, pob-codes or custom guides from clipboard into this guide slot

importing will reset your progress:
you can long-click the > button in the guide-overlay to re-sync the guide to the zone you're currently in(/highlight)
leveltracker editor: open the editor to edit the guide in this slot
leveltracker guide info: there are up to nine individual guide slots you can use and switch between
each slot has its own data for: guide & progress, gear, skill-tree, timer

credits:
- default guide originally derived from exile-leveling by heartofphos
- contains several act optimizations based on cyclondefinitiv's guide
leveltracker gems:
right-click to open gem-pickup configuration:
when and/or whether to pick up specific gems during the campaign
click to toggle whether gem-quests should be included in the guide or not (reduces backtracking and npc interactions)

on: you pick up gems via questing
off: you buy gems separately (lilly/trading)
this toggle is forced to on if <league-start> is on (/highlight)
leveltracker guide info 2: there are up to nine individual guide slots you can use and switch between
each slot has its own data for: guide & progress, gear, skill-tree, timer
credits: acts 1-3 originally derived from u/xebtria's quick-guide
leveltracker guide format info: each line has one or more steps you need to complete
(hint)__ indented lines provide more info for the step above
optional: lines marked with a plus-sign show optional steps
(hint)__ they can be enabled/disabled with the (quest:optionals) toggle in the settings
when handing in quests, (img:skip) means the npc has quests queued up
(hint)__ these don't have relevant rewards and can be skipped
if there's a (img:craft) or (color:00FFFF)this_highlighting, hold down the widget-key to see more info
(img:in-out2) zone-name for x: this means "enter (color:CC99FF)zone to get x, then leave again"
(img:0), (img:2): these show cardinal directions, i.e. north, east, etc.
(hint)__ direct pathing might sometimes be blocked (you'll have to walk around)
leveltracker guide format info 2: each line has one or more steps you need to complete
(hint)__ indented lines provide more info for the step above
(color:FF00FF)x_tasks / (color:FF00FF)find_x: some lines have x sub-tasks you need to complete
(hint)__ they can be completed in random order or at the same time (zone-dependent)
optional: lines marked with a plus-sign show optional steps
(hint)__ they can be enabled/disabled with the (quest:optionals) toggle in the settings
if text is (color:00FFFF)highlighted_like_this, hold down the widget-key to see an image
(img:in-out2) zone-name for x: this means "enter (color:CC99FF)zone to get x, then leave again"
(img:0), (img:2): these show cardinal directions, i.e. north, east, etc.
(hint)__ direct pathing might sometimes be blocked (you'll have to walk around)
leveltracker leaguestart: choose whether quests/objectives that only need to be done once per league should be shown or not (e.g. lab trials, crafting recipes)
if a pob import with gems is present and league-start is disabled, some gem-quests may be replaced with hideout lilly instead

toggling this setting will reset your progress:
you can long-click the > button in the guide-overlay to re-sync the guide to the zone you're currently in(/highlight)
leveltracker bandit: choose which bandit you want to help in act 2

toggling this setting will reset your progress:
you can long-click the > button in the guide-overlay to re-sync the guide to the zone you're currently in(/highlight)
leveltracker leaguestart 2: choose whether quests/objectives that only need to be done once per league should be shown or not

toggling this setting will reset your progress:
you can long-click the > button in the guide-overlay to re-sync the guide to the zone you're currently in(/highlight)
leveltracker optionals:
whether optional loot/quests/encounters should be included
examples: strongboxes, gear/flask quests, vendor recipes
they will be marked with a plus-sign in the guide(/highlight)
leveltracker optionals 2: choose whether optional loot/quests should be shown or not
they will be marked with a plus-sign in the guide(/highlight)
examples: jeweller's/artificer's orbs, gems, jewelry, flasks, a4 treasure map
leveltracker reset: long-click to reset the progress in this guide slot and start over
leveltracker character info: optional: enter the name of the character you will play while using this guide
this enables level tracking and e-exp calculations
this name will also be applied to the <general> section, i.e. this character will be tracked globally(/highlight)
leveltracker character status: yellow: char not found / refresh required
leveltracker profile name: optional: enter a description/name for the build you will play with this guide
it will also be applied to the <general> section, i.e. this description will be used globally(/highlight)
leveltracker pob preview: long-click to check available pob data
leveltracker hotkeys enable: allows you to switch guide-pages via customizable hotkeys
leveltracker hotkeys: type in a key-name and press <enter>
don't bind it to modifier-keys or keys used for chatting
lootfilter enable: provides an interface to modify your lootfilter and apply changes on the fly
macros fast-travel: commands are bound to a single hotkey

tap: use the hideout command
hold: open menu-widget with commands(/highlight)
click the icons below to enable/disable commands
macros custom: commands are bound to a single hotkey

tap: use command 0 on the list
hold: open menu-widget with commands(/highlight)
to disable commands, either click the number-labels or leave the fields blank
macros hotkeys: for special keys, check the ahk-link above to find the proper names
leave it blank to disable this feature
macros label: for custom macros, the menu-widget will display a text-label instead of an icon
enter a text-label of up to 3 characters
macros command: enter the chat command you want to use
maptracker enable: provides automated tracking of your map runs, and a log viewer with export tools
tracks map-times, deaths, portals, loot, kills, and certain types of side-content
maptracker rename: tags and renames boss maps for easier searching

example:
<boss: elder> instead of <absence of value and meaning>
maptracker rename 2: tags and renames boss maps for easier searching
maptracker character: your character's name, class, and level will be logged
optional: name/description of the build can also be logged
you have to specify this info in the <general> section of the settings
maptracker side-content: side-areas you enter and the time spent inside will be logged
examples: abyssal depths, lab trials, vaal areas, starfall crater
maptracker side-content 2: side-areas you enter and the time spent inside will be logged
maptracker hide: hides the panel instead of just graying it out whenever tracking is paused (by right-clicking the button in the menu-widget)
maptracker mechanics: logs certain mechanics you encounter while mapping
maptracker dialogue tracking: these mechanics can be tracked automatically via in-game dialogue
requires enabling <output dialogue to chat> at the bottom of the game's <ui> settings(/highlight)
maptracker screen tracking: these mechanics will be tracked by searching the screen for specific ui elements
the screen will be checked whenever you hold down the <widget-key>
maptracker screenmechanic: right-click to open the snipping tool and screen-cap a unique ui element of the mechanic
maptracker portal reminder: when using a portal scroll, a tooltip will remind you to double-check if map content has been completed
requires you to specify the correct in-game hotkey below
maptracker portal hotkey: type in the in-game hotkey for <use portal scroll>
check the links above if it uses special keys/combinations
maptracker loot-tracker: items you ctrl-click into the stash will be logged
ctrl-right-click will remove previously added items one by one (similar to ctrl-z in text editing)
requires the <stash> image-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
maptracker kill-tracker: monster kills in completed maps will be logged
leaving a map causes the tracker panel to flash until you click the timer to refresh kills
refreshing kills only has to be done if you have finished the map and won't go back in
maptracker mapinfo:
map-mods from the <map-info> feature will be logged
(separate feature, has to be enabled and actively used)

this also includes information such as:
elder guardians, conquerors, type of maven invitation, blight(-ravaged), contract/blueprint
maptracker notes: adds an icon to the tracker panel to log custom notes for individual map runs
also enables you to easily log items with a single click, e.g. map-device items used, special drops found in a run, etc.
maptracker color unselected: used for highlighted cells in the log-viewer, and for non-league dates in the date selection
click to open the color-palette, right-click to reset to default
maptracker color selected: used for the currently-selected year and its months in the date selection
click to open the color-palette, right-click to reset to default
maptracker color leagues: used to highlight dates within a certain league
click to open the color-palette, right-click to reset to default
mapinfo enable: provides a compact and customizable info-panel for map mods

pressing the <omni-key> over a map opens the panel:
- press 1-4 while hovering mods to apply colors
- press <space> while hovering mods to ignore
- right-click mods to reset them
mapinfo toggle: press the <omni-key> while hovering over maps/waystones to activate the panel
click into the game or press <esc> to close it
mapinfo hold: long-press the <omni-key> over maps/waystones to activate the panel
the panel will close automatically once you release the key
the horizons tooltip will instead be activated by long-pressing <alt> + <omni-key>(/highlight)
mapinfo hold 2: long-press the <omni-key> over maps/waystones to activate the panel
the panel will close automatically once you release the key
mapinfo shift-click: refreshes the tooltip whenever you apply currency to maps via shift-click
you have to long-press <shift> first, right click currency, and then click a map
requires the <inventory> pixel-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
mapinfo tab: hold down the <widget-key> to view a compact version of the panel on the right of the screen
only works in hideouts and the map that was loaded into the panel
mapinfo colors: click a button to open the color-palette, right click to reset
mapinfo logbooks: logbook mods use positive rankings, with 4 being the best value
mapinfo modsearch: type in map-mods (in-game wording) and press <enter> to list them below
mapinfo roll highlight: map rolls (quant, rarity, etc.) will be highlighted if they meet certain requirements
mapinfo roll colors: this is a preview of the current highlighting settings
click the colored buttons on the right to open the palette, right-click to reset the color to default

first button: text color
second button: background color
mapinfo requirements: specify desired minimum values for each roll
quantity, rarity, pack size, maps, scarabs, currency
mapinfo requirements 2: specify desired minimum values for each roll
mapinfo mod settings: below, you can customize the tiering of specific map mods
hover over mods and press number keys 1-4 to apply highlighting, space to strike them out, or right-click to reset them to un-tiered (white)
use the mod search to find mods, click the – and + buttons to (un)pin mods for quick access
mapinfo reset tiers: long-click to reset every map mod tier to default (white, not crossed out)
(/highlight)this affects every single mod, not just the pinned ones below
alarm enable: timer-widget with alarm/countdown and stopwatch functionality
hidden by default: hold down the <widget-key> to access it
map-events enable: displays notifications whenever certain map events spawn
examples: nameless seer, reflecting mist, infamous mercenary
map-events enable event: right-click to activate a test notification
map-events position: the notification will be docked to one of the client's edges
notepad enable: notepad tool with individual tabs, and floating widgets that can be used as sticky-notes
adds a button to the menu-widget: click it to toggle the notepad, right-click it to create a single-use sticky note
notepad default color: specify the default colors for widgets of new tabs
these can be customized for each tab afterwards
notepad opacity: the opacity of inactive widgets (i.e. when not holding down the <widget-key>)
lab enable: simple lab layout overlay and tracker for casual runs
while in lab or the aspirants' plaza, hold down the <widget-key> to activate the overlay
ocr enable: screen-reading feature that scans the screen and displays certain information/text in customizable & compact tooltips
currently supported: eldritch altars, vaal side areas
ocr compatibility: screen-reading feature that scans the screen and displays certain information/text in customizable & compact tooltips
a compatibility test has to be done before this feature can be enabled
open the character-stats screen, then click this checkbox to open the windows snipping tool
use it to snip 4 to 5 lines of text from the character-stats
ocr colors: customize the color patterns used to highlight specific mods/rewards
ocr debug: holding down the right crtl-key while scanning the screen will open a window that displays the screen-cap as well as the text the tool was able to read from it
ocr z hotkey: type in the in-game hotkey for <toggle highlighting>
check the links above if it uses special keys/combinations
ocr hotkey: type in the hotkey you want to use to activate this feature
don't bind it to modifier-keys or keys used for chatting in order to prevent accidentally activating the feature
check the links above if you want to use special keys/combinations
sanctum enable: analyzes rooms and connections on the floor map and provides tools for highlighting and planning
while you're in the sanctum/trial and the floor plan is on screen, hold down the <omni-key> to show the overlay
the overlay will hide when you release the key: press <space> to lock the overlay so it doesn't automatically hide
requires the <sanctum/sekhema floor map> screen-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
sanctum cheatsheet: shows an additional panel that lists the different room types and their objectives, as well as special fountain characteristics
sanctum relics:
provides an overlay for relic management:
summarizes and groups relic effects, and provides search/highlight functionality
while the relic altar is open, long-press the <omni-key> over a relic to open the overlay
requires the <inventory> pixel-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
screenchecks pixel-about: the tool continually checks the screen for certain ui elements
this enables context sensitivity and automatic overlay toggling
these checks will never result in any interaction with the client
screenchecks pixel-calibration: follow the instructions from <info> before clicking this
captures certain pixel-values and stores them for future checks
screenchecks pixel-test: click this button while the ui element shown in <info> is visible, the test should return positive
click it again while the ui element shown in <info> is not visible, the test should return negative
geforce now: move your character around a bit, then redo steps 1 & 2
screenchecks image-about: these checks are used to interpret which feature to activate when pressing the omni-key
screenchecks image-calibration: follow the instructions from <info> before clicking this
right-click: manually screen-cap the ui element shown in <info>
screenchecks image-test: click this button while the ui element shown in <info> is visible, the test should return positive
click it again while the ui element shown in <info> is not visible, the test should return negative
if tests keep returning negative after automatic calibration, right-click the <cal> button and snip the marked area shown in <info>
screenchecks folder: opens the folder with calibration files
if tests keep failing, open the img-files to check if they represent the correct image-clip
screenchecks variance: since streaming-clients have variable image quality, the tool may not be able to accurately check the screen for certain ui elements
if clicking <test> doesn't return consistent, repeatable results, you may have to increase the allowed variance of screen-checks
increase the value in increments of 10 and retest the checks until the results are consistent
searchstrings about: search-strings are grouped into use-cases, e.g. gwennen, harvest, vendor
when pressing the <omni-key>, the tool detects the right use-case and displays a list with entries to choose from
this detection requires manual image calibration for each use-case
searchstrings calibrate: opens the clipping tool: use it to clip a ui element that is unique to the search
searchstrings test: click this button while the ui element is on screen, the test should return positive
click it again while the ui element is not on screen, the test should return negative
results have to be consistent and repeatable
searchstrings edit: opens a menu where strings for this use-case can be added or edited
searchstrings delete: long-click to delete this use-case and its strings
searchstrings copy: enter a name below, then click this button to create a copy of this use-case with a new name
searchstrings enable-beastcrafting: this is included by default and contains strings for flask crafting
searchstrings enable-lilly: this is part of the imported leveling guide and contains strings for every gem(/highlight)
searchstrings add: type in a name and press <enter>
stash color tag1: this is what price tags with poe.ninja-prices look like
stash color tag2: this is what price tags with exchange-prices look like
stash color tag3: this is what bookmarked price tags look like
stash enable: stash feature that overlays price-tags onto items in specific stash tabs
long-press the <omni-key> while hovering over an item in a tab to activate the feature
there needs to be at least one tab-folder somewhere in your stash (the overlay will be slightly offset otherwise)(/highlight)
stash enable 2: stash feature that overlays poe.ninja price-tags onto items in specific stash tabs
long-press the <omni-key> while hovering over an item in a tab to activate the feature
stash hotkey: this hotkey is exclusive to streaming clients, and pressing it will open an exclusive selection menu that lists the available tabs
don't bind it to modifier-keys or keys used for chatting: type in a key-name and press <enter>
stash history: shows an additional bar-chart with an item's price history for this week
this will be shown next to conversion rates when hovering over a highlighted item-slot
it's a timeline with bars that each represent a day and display the change in price compared to the first day
stash exalt: also shows exalt-equivalent prices when hovering over highlighted items or pricing items
stash bulk: right-clicking an item in a tab will open an additional panel for (bulk-)sale management

it will only show poe.ninja prices initially:
click a currency icon to view open listings on the bulk exchange, or right-click it to refresh the data
pick a price from the list, and the panel will offer applicable bulk configurations to scroll through and pick from
stash mintrade:
you can specify an "i don't want to trade below x chaos" value here:
type in a number and press <enter>
bulk-sale configurations in chaos will auto-adjust to start at this value
stash autoprofiles: this setting is meant to help you find (stacks of) items that are worth trading
profiles 1-4 will be set up automatically according to your preferred trade value

>> rule of thumb <<
highlighted items are worth trading if:
stack-size >= profile-number
profile 5 will be left untouched in order to allow creating a trash/vendor tier
stash config: to configure individual tabs, open them in game and long-press the <omni-key> over an item in the tab
once the stash-ninja overlay is active, settings for the active tab will appear below
stash gap: refers to the horizontal gap between item boxes/slots in the stash tab
fine-tune this value to align the overlay and in-game stash
stash in folder: the overlay's position has to be offset if this specific tab is in a stash folder
check this box if this tab is in a folder
stash bookmarking: adds a bookmark-list next to the price-profile panel
press space while hovering over an item to add 1x to the current list, or press alt to remove 1x
bookmarked items will always be highlighted on the grid, regardless of active price-profile
each tab has 5 separate lists: hold down <control> or <shift>, and press number-keys to switch
stash limits: you can configure up to 5 price-range profiles for each individual tab

input-box structure:
profile # | max value
unit: c, d, % | min value
leaving min/max price blank will treat them as unlimited, leaving the unit blank will disable the profile entirely
while the overlay is on screen, press number-keys 1 to 5 to switch between profiles
stash limits 2: you can configure up to 5 price-range profiles for each individual tab

input-box structure:
profile # | max value
unit: c, e, d, % | min value
leaving min/max price blank will treat them as unlimited, leaving the unit blank will disable the profile entirely
while the overlay is on screen, press number-keys 1 to 5 to switch between profiles
statlas enable: atlas feature that displays various information about maps on the atlas
long-press the <omni-key> over maps on the atlas to activate the overlay
scroll to adjust the image size
requires the <atlas> screen-check to be set up correctly in the <screen-checks> section(/highlight)
statlas maptracker: the overlay will show stats collected via the map-tracker feature
statlas notable: the atlas notable <local knowledge> provides loot-drop bonuses for different biomes
if enabled, the overlay will show the bonuses for the map you're hovering over
updater check: checks for updates on tool launch and in the background while running
the menu-widget will blink if there is an update available
updater hotfix: a hotfix release is available, you can download it below
the versions listed below always include the newest hotfixes, even if the number is not specifically marked
updater versions: the list below shows the available versions to switch between or reinstall
each line represents a major version and has buttons to select the minor version
versions with important changes are highlighted in orange(/highlight)
hover over a button to see a summarized changelog, click it to prepare the download
updater full changelog: opens the github page with the detailed changelog of the selected version
updater restart:
click to update and restart
NOTE: active overlays and unsaved data will be lost
updater manual: downloads a zip-file with the complete release, then opens it and the tool-folder
the zip contains one folder: do not extract it! open it instead
extract what's inside into the tool-folder that will open in a separate window
updater github: opens your browser and downloads the newest version
also opens the tool folder in a separate window
updater skip: long-click to skip this version and no longer receive notifications
notifications will start showing again with the next version

add:
click: add a new timer
r-click: add a new stop-watch
drag: drag to reposition the whole widget
name: long-right-click to permanently remove this timer
orientation: toggle between horizontal and vertical layout
set name: optional: enter a name to create a permanent, reusable timer
un-named timers are lost when restarting the tool(/highlight)
set time: supported formats: hh:mm:ss, hh mm ss
leave blank to use the timer as a stopwatch
timer:
left-click to loop the timer
right-click to stop the timer

materials: hover over materials in your stash/inventory and press the <omni-key> to load the available amounts
alternatively, hover over the icons below and scroll the mouse-wheel to manually adjust the amounts
keywords: this optional search method uses groups (similar to the trade site) and keywords

keywords are sorted by occurrence (high to low):
left-click keywords to add them to the <and> group
long-click keywords to add them to the <count> group
right-click keywords to add them to the <not> group
type strings into the search-bar and press <enter> to highlight keywords
matches: left-click a box below to highlight the node on the in-game passive tree (make sure it's open)
right-click boxes to hide unwanted nodes until only useful ones are left
numbers after node names = required # of upgrades/reforges
type a string into the search-bar and press <enter> to filter the results (supports regex)
reforging: whether reforging/upgrading materials should be included to make more recipes available: only 2 tiers above the highest available material are taken into account

image general: f1: zoom out, f2: zoom in, f3: reset zoom

segmented image sheets:
space: clear selection
long-press the <widget-key>: show the whole sheet

menu screencheck: refers to the position of the ui element that activates this sheet
static: always stays in the same position, e.g. stash/inventory plaque
menu activation: how long the sheet stays on screen after activation
activating a sheet by pressing two modifier keys will always <toggle>
menu image-files: image files are loaded into numbered slots within each sheet
while the sheet is active, press number keys to access these files
slot 00 is reserved for segmented sheets (hover <00> for more info)
menu 00: loading an image into 00 turns the sheet into a segmented one
only works if the information on it is presented in a table or diagram
image 00 is the header of the sheet, the rest are individual segments (e.g. columns or rows)
menu header: positioning of the header relative to the rest of the segments
menu paste: paste image(s) into this slot: supports files and raw data
pasting multiple files at once overwrites x slots, starting with this one
menu snip0: opens the snipping widget to snip images into slots
menu snip: opens the clipping tool to clip images into slots
menu show: long-click to see a preview of the image
menu delete: long-click to delete the image in this slot
menu hotkey: type in a letter to tag the image
that letter can be used like a hotkey to activate this slot
useful if data in the sheet is alphabetical and not numerical
menu preview: long-click to see a preview of the sheet
menu entry-about: every cheat sheet has multiple entries, and each entry up to 4 notes
an entry is simply something in the game you want to save notes for

syndicate: each member is an entry
sanctum: each room is an entry
menu entry-image: long-click to view the calibration image
menu entry-select: click this entry to access its notes
menu entry-preview: long-click to see a preview of this entry's notes
menu windowtitle: title of the window you want to use as a cheat sheet
it is case-sensitive but doesn't require the whole title
menu exe-delete: long-click to remove the app from the launcher
menu exe-test: click to check if the app launches correctly

chaos-div:
the current div-price in chaos (e.g. 210):
this value is used to convert chaos to divines when logging trades
exalt-div:
the current div-price in exalts (e.g. 210):
this value is used to convert exalt to divines when logging trades
currency icons:
optional: click a currency icon to log your in-/outflow of main currency
(the transaction will be logged when clicking <place order>)
edit fields: enter a value, or scroll to adjust the current value (hold down <shift> to adjust by 10)
click in-game fields to copy values here, or right-click them to paste from here
press <space> while hovering in-game fields to reset them
logs: click a date to view trades from that day
long-right-click on a date or trade to delete it
ratio: scroll to adjust both values according to the ratio (hold down shift to adjust by 10x)
click to lock the ratio: values will now be adjusted as close to this ratio as possible
ratio 2: the actual ratio compared to the locked one

about: click items on the list to highlight them in in-game searches
long-right-click an item to remove it from the list
press the <omni-key> on items to add them to the list
clear highlighted: long-click to remove every highlighted item from the list
clear gems: long-click to remove every gem from the list

button: red = layout unavailable/outdated, yellow = layout only, green = layout + tracking
click to open poelab.com: select difficulty, right-click layout image, click <copy image>
optional: right-click <lab compass file>, click <copy link address>, press ctrl + a and then ctrl + c

skilltree-cap about: load images into slots via pasting or snipping
skilltree-cap ascend: load images into slots via pasting or snipping
slot 05 is reserved for a potential endgame respec or alternative tree
skilltree-cap index: click to add a caption to this slot
skilltree-cap paste: paste image file or data into this slot
skilltree-cap snip: opens the snipping widget, or triggers a screen-cap
skilltree-cap caption: type in a caption and press <enter>

add page: insert a new guide page after this one
conditions: you can choose to only show/include certain guide pages under specific conditions
export: copy the guide data into the clipboard
guide reset: long-click to load the default guide
(/highlight)your progress and custom edits will be deleted
preview: long-click to see a preview of this guide page
remove panel: long-click to remove this page from the guide
save: long-click to save the changes to this guide slot
your current guide progress will be reset(/highlight)
search: type in strings to search within the currently selected act
pages with matching text will be highlighted green on the page-selection bar

general: hold down <alt> to temporarily hide the overlay
select a skill set from the list on the left
click <all x gems> to start an in-game search: this will include every gem of the matching type within every socket group
below that, there's a list of all the socket groups from the selected skill set: it only includes groups where the <main gem> matches the uncut gem you initially clicked on (skill or spirit)
click a socket group to start an in-game search: this will include every gem from the group
adjust when and/or whether to pick up specific gems during the campaign
select <skip> if you don't want to pick up certain gems (e.g. if you are already muling them with a different character)
save-reset: applying/reverting changes will also reset your guide progress(/highlight)

color spec: color used to highlight new nodes

left-click to open the color palette
right-click to reset to default
color unspec: color used to highlight nodes to unspec

left-click to open the color palette
right-click to reset to default
how-to: press <q> or <e> to switch between individual skill-trees
hold down <w> to show an overview of the whole tree
hold down number-keys <1> through <4> to show the individual ascendancy-trees

l-click: drag in-game tree || r-click: drag overlay
(both can be dragged simultaneously)
m-click: snap white/yellow circle to cursor
hold down <alt> to temporarily hide the overlay
opacity: adjust the opacity of the overlay (default: 100)

alignment: toggles alignment of images: horizontal or vertical
drag:
drag to move the overlay
r-click to reset to default position
flip:
click: mirror horizontally
r-click: mirror vertically
when unsure how to match indicators, always try mirroring before rotating(/highlight)
help panel:
general:
scroll to zoom, hold down m-mouse for info
press space to (un)lock the overlay
if images have orange borders, they are inconclusive examples of possible layouts, rotations, mirrors (just to give a rough idea)(/highlight)
press <q> to revert all modifications and selections/discards
reset: click to reset image modifications and selections/discards for this zone
rotate:
click: rotate 90 degrees
r-click: rotate -90 degrees
when unsure how to match indicators, always try mirroring before rotating(/highlight)

add stack: enter a stack size, then click this label to add a custom stack rule for this base type
apply mods: long-click to create and apply the new file
(/highlight)the /itemfilter in-game command will be used, so make sure the chat box is closed and accessible
backgroundcolor: click to select the background color, right-click to reset to the previous color
bordercolor: click to select the border color, right-click to reset to the previous color
textcolor: click to select the text color, right-click to reset to the previous color
basefilter: select the filter you want to use as the base
a separate file with your customizations will be created and then applied in game, leaving the base filter unchanged
global item-classes: enabling this option will reveal additional checkboxes underneath
you have to tick at least one item-class to enable this override

this will also hide high-tier items:
unidentified (tier x)
global overrides: the options below can be used to quickly modify filtering for larger item-groups
changes made here will always take precedence over individual customizations, even if the search-results list may not reflect it
gui color: click to select the background color underneath item labels, or right-click to reset to default
hide: hide the entire item-group in game
highlight color: click to select the color used to highlight rule modifications, or right-click to reset to default
incompatible: some modifications no longer apply to the new base filter and will be discarded after applying the updates
this usually means that the new base filter no longer has a specific rule you toggled previously
modifications: list of modifications currently applied/pending: long-click this header panel to clear the whole list
(shift-)click an item name to search for the base type(s), right-click to remove it
refresh: reload the folder's contents, the selected base filter, and the modded filter
revert: revert every modification in this group
search: type in item base types and press <enter> to search for existing rules: supports regex, and comma-separation for multi-searches
you can also (shift-)omni-click items in game to search for the base type(s)
search reset: clear the current search, and show global override options
style color: click to select the color used to highlight style modifications, or right-click to reset to default

logviewer day-select: open the date selection: shows a breakdown of logged map runs
the current search-filter will affect the available dates
logviewer date help: general: click a button to show runs within that period, long-press <del> while hovering to delete those runs
years: click a year to show its breakdown below, double-click to load the whole year
logviewer export: long-click to export the list of runs below as a CSV-file, overwriting any existing file with the same date
right-click to open the export folder
logviewer page-entries: how many entries to show on each page (auto = log-viewer will adjust to available screen space)
logviewer search:
each column has a search bar that supports regex and custom patterns (hover over them for more info):
press <enter> to start a search with every input at once, or click the red x to restore the unfiltered log-viewer
logviewer sum avg: click highlighted cells in this row to display the data within a column as totals / percentages / averages
logviewer header map: long-click a map name to edit it, long-right-click to delete the run

map names are clickable for searching:
click to paste "<name>" into the search, r-click to paste "!<name>", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search tier:
supported inputs:
"x" (exact tier), "!x" (exclude), "x-y" (between x and y), "x+" (x or higher)
logviewer header tier: the tier (map) or level (e.g. contract) of the run

numbers are clickable for searching:
click to paste "<tier>" into the search, r-click to paste "!<tier>", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search run:
supported inputs:
"x" (exact time), "x-y" (between x and y), "x+" (x or longer)
if x/y don't include any colons, they will be treated as seconds, otherwise as (hh:)mm:ss
logviewer header run: the time it took to complete the run
logviewer header e-exp: effective exp gained in a map (i.e. after penalties), based on your level and the monsters'
you have to specify your character's name in the <general> section of the settings first
logviewer search deaths:
supported inputs:
"x" (exact value), "x-y" (between x and y), "x+" (x or higher)
logviewer header deaths: number of deaths in a run

header is clickable for searching:
click to paste "1+" into the search, r-click to paste "0", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search portals:
supported inputs:
"x" (exact value), "x-y" (between x and y), "x+" (x or higher)
logviewer header portals: number of portals used in a run
logviewer search kills:
supported inputs:
"x" (exact value), "x-y" (between x and y), "x+" (x or higher)
logviewer header kills: monsters killed in a run (optional, has to be enabled first): uses the in-game /kills command

header is clickable for searching:
click to paste "1+" into the search, r-click to paste "0", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search loot:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)
logviewer header loot:
loot found in a map (optional, has to be enabled first):
click highlighted cells in this column to view a list with logged loot

header is clickable for searching:
click to paste "yes" into the search, r-click to paste "no", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search mapinfo:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)

you can search for mods and also general rolls, e.g. "100q" for 100% quantity
(for general rolls, it will always search for "x and above")
logviewer search mapinfo 2:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)
logviewer header mapinfo:
mods rolled on a map (optional, has to be enabled first):
click highlighted cells in this column to view a list of logged mods

header is clickable for searching:
click to paste "yes" into the search, r-click to paste "no", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search notes:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)
logviewer header notes:
custom notes for runs (adding notes during/before the run is optional and has to be enabled first):
right-click cells in this column to add/edit notes after the run, click highlighted cells to view them

header is clickable for searching:
click to paste "yes" into the search, r-click to paste "no", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search character:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)
"x" (exact level), "x-y" (between x and y), "x+" (x or higher)
logviewer header character:
information about the character (and build) played in the run:
click highlighted cells in this column to view this information

header is clickable for searching:
click to paste "yes" into the search, r-click to paste "no", double-(r-)click to search immediately
logviewer search content:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)
available short-hand inputs: "elder" for elder guardians, "sirus" for conquerors
logviewer search content 2:
supported inputs:
"xyz" (search), "!abc" (exclude), "xyz !abc" (search xyz, exclude abc), "abc, xyz, ..." (search abc, and xyz, ...)
logviewer header content: side-content you encountered in a map (optional, has to be enabled first)

header & icons are clickable for searching:
click to paste "<content>" into the search, r-click to paste "!<content>", double-(r-)click to search immediately

help: type in custom notes and press <enter>: include "X#" before the note to limit it to X runs

press the <omni-key> over items to add them to the notes:
map-device items are highlighted yellow and limited to 4
long-click a note to remove it, or the header to clear everything

colors: text color: click to open the color-palette, right-click to reset
colors1: background color: click to open the color-palette, right-click to reset
widget: click to select tab, drag to create a widget, long-right-click to delete
widget help: widgets are inactive (unclickable) unless the <widget-key> is held down
left-click to drag widgets, right-click to destroy widgets
you can create scrollable widgets with individual pages by separating the text with lines that only contain a single hash-sign (#)
widget grouped: drag to combine every note into a single, scrollable widget

calibrate paths: click to open the snipping tool and calibrate the scanner for pathing: use right-click and wasd for more precise snipping
long-right-click to delete previous calibration data and start over
calibrate rooms: click to open the snipping tool and calibrate the scanner for room count and positions
long-right-click to delete previous calibration data and start over
general:
press <space> to lock the overlay so it doesn't automatically hide
press <esc> to close it

click a room to mark it as a target room:
green highlighting will show the available pathing

right-click one or more rooms you want to avoid:
purple highlighting will show the pathing you need to avoid, and black highlighting will show which rooms will become completely blocked

middle-click a room to treat it as the current room:
every room that is no longer relevant will be blacked out. you can also hold it down and hover back and forth between rooms.
scan: click to scan the map, long-right-click to view the scan result

general: right-click relics to load them into the grid
note: always move the cursor to the top-left corner of the relic(/highlight)
hold down <alt> to temporarily hide boxes
press <esc> to close the overlay: it will also close when clicking <confirm> in game
mods: click up to 2 mods to highlight corresponding relics
right-click mods to highlight corresponding relics in the in-game stash
clear: long-click to clear the grid and mod-list

atlas: -> open the atlas: the plaque at the top (img) has to be fully visible
-> click <cal> to let the tool calibrate, OR right-click to manually calibrate
betrayal: -> open the syndicate board: the x-button (img) has to be fully visible
-> click <cal> to let the tool calibrate, OR right-click to manually calibrate
exchange: -> make sure the inventory is closed
gamescreen: -> this check is used to (loosely) determine whether a full-screen ui is on screen
-> close every in-game menu: atlas, inventory, etc.
-> the minimap has to be in the center
-> the infopanel (img) has to be fully visible
gamescreen 2: -> this check is used to (loosely) determine whether a full-screen ui is on screen
-> close every in-game menu: atlas, inventory, etc.
-> the minimap has to be in the center
-> the infopanel (img) has to be fully visible
-> long-click the <cal> button: a 'crosshair' and zoom-widget will follow the cursor
-> drag the 'crosshair' onto a letter in the infopanel (as shown on the img)
inventory: -> the top-right corner (img: yellow) has to be fully visible
sanctum: -> open the floor map: the plaque at the top (img) has to be fully visible
-> click <cal> to let the tool calibrate, OR right-click to manually calibrate
skilltree: -> open the skilltree: the plaque at the top (img) has to be fully visible
-> click <cal> to let the tool calibrate, OR right-click to manually calibrate
stash: -> click <cal> to let the tool calibrate, OR right-click to manually calibrate

tier: scroll the mouse-wheel to adjust this filter

leveltracker close:
close the guide overlay:
the overlay will stay closed until toggled on again
leveltracker geartracker:
geartracker:
notifies you when you meet gear or gem requirements after lvl-ups
leveltracker leveltracker:
toggle the guide overlay:
the overlay will stay closed until lvl-up or zone transition
settings sub-menu: open the settings for this feature

color 1: click: customize   |   r-click: reset to default
used to highlight characteristics that match
color 2: click: customize   |   r-click: reset to default
used to highlight incompatibilities that prevent simulation
color 3: click: customize   |   r-click: reset to default
used to highlight things that require attention because they influence the outcome
basics: one item will be randomly chosen as the final base and retains its influences, tags (e.g. corrupted, split), quality, implicits, enchants, anoints
you can manipulate odds by crafting/editing mods

influence-mods cannot be moved to bases that don't have the required influence,
fractured mods cannot be moved from the original base and only add to the general affix pool there

(/highlight)note: mod-weighting hasn't been figured out yet, so results become less accurate the more non-exclusive mods are present in each affix-group (e.g. when combining random loot as opposed to target-crafting the inputs)
exclusive: whether or not a mod is "exclusive" (i.e. part of a specific group and therefore affected by restrictions)
only a single exclusive mod can be recombined onto the final item
examples: breach, incursion, essence, bestiary, betrayal & veiled, delve, named bench-crafts (tora's, chosen, of the order, etc.) & metamods, elevated mods
lock: locks the item-slot so it won't be automatically overwritten or cleared when loading items or closing the panel
nnn: whether or not a mod is "non-native, natural" (i.e. restricted to specific bases)
these mods can only be recombined if the final base meets specific requirements
examples: influenced, attribute/defense-specific, and fractured mods
(/highlight)loading new items into the panel will automatically reset/recheck whether mods are nnn

config entry-about:
create a custom list of strings for this use-case by adding entries:
type in a descriptive name for the entry and press <enter>

example-list for harvest crafting:
- sacrifice corrupted map
- sacrifice div card
- change resistance
config entry-list: click an entry to edit its string(s), long-click <del> to remove it

paste the string(s) into the edit-field on the right:
you can add multiple strings per entry by pasting them into separate lines
when activating an entry with multiple strings, you can scroll the mouse-wheel to paste them into the game one after the other

import: imports a jewel from clipboard (e.g. copied from trade)
trade: opens the trade-site with a search for this seed
download: the required databases have not been downloaded yet
click this button to start the download
legion notables: the list below shows every legion notable of the current jewel type
hover over notables to see their effects, right-click them to mark them as desired
legion notables socket: the list below shows the resulting modifications after slotting this jewel into the selected jewel slot

hover over notables to see their effects,
click them to highlight their position on the in-game skilltree,
right-click them to mark them as desired
socket: the list below shows the regular notables around the currently-selected jewel socket
click a notable to highlight it on the in-game skilltree, right-click it to mark it as allocated
allocated notables are highlighted green, or yellow if the current seed turns it into a desired legion notable
tree: click a jewel socket to load it into the explorer above, or click it again to deselect it

each socket may be labeled with numbers if the seed results in desired legion notables:
- teal labels show the number of desired legion notables around the socket
- yellow labels show the number of allocated notables that will turn into desired legion notables
update: click this button to check for database updates

about: resize and place this widget over an area you want to screencap
use arrow keys to move/resize the widget by 1 pixel

hold down <alt> to resize instead of moving,
hold down <ctrl> to move/resize by 10 pixels
click <snip> on a specific slot to save the image into it
